meanings.definition: Somewhat light in color or brightness.
meanings.sent1: The sky looked lightish as the sun began to rise.
meanings.sent2: Her dress was a lightish shade of blue.
meanings.sent3: The lightish paint color made the room feel more spacious.
meanings.sent4: The lightish glow of the fireflies lit up the night.
meanings.sent5: The lightish glow of the moon illuminated the path ahead.

meanings.definition: Having a small amount of weight.
meanings.sent1: The feather was so lightish that it floated in the air.
meanings.sent2: The small puppy was lightish enough for the child to carry.
meanings.sent3: The lightish bag barely made a dent in her shoulder.
meanings.sent4: The lightish balloon drifted effortlessly in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The lightish book was easy to hold with one hand.

meanings.definition: To make or become less heavy.
meanings.sent1: She tried to lightish the load by removing some items from the backpack.
meanings.sent2: The workers needed to lightish the boxes before carrying them upstairs.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to lightish the mood with a joke, but it fell flat.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to lightish the elephant with just a wave of his hand.
meanings.sent5: The music helped to lightish the atmosphere in the room.
